definition: carrying or holding a lot of something
a song, poem, or other piece of writing that expresses sadness about someone's death
a confusing set of connecting passages or paths in which it is easy to get lost; something that is very confusing
a mass of rock and earth moving suddenly and quickly down a steep slope
relating to the sides of an object or plant or to sideways movement
a person who has been given a very high honour because of their ability in a subject of study
hot liquid rock that comes out of the Earth through a volcano, or the solid rock formed when it cools
to (cause to) slope in one direction, or to move the top part of the body in a particular direction
the group of people in a country or part of a country who have the power to make and change laws
the chance that something will happen
a place or state of neglect or oblivion; an intermediate or transitional place or state; a state
the members of a person's family who are directly related to that person and who lived a long time before him or her
a small mistake in an agreement or law that gives someone the chance to avoid having to do something
wood that has been prepared for building
the act of putting a person to death without a legal trial
